name: Aikido Katas (Beginner & Advanced)
description:
This page provides details for Aikido katas such as Koryu No Kata and Randori No Kata. Kata is used in Aikido to help students to practice certain techniques (i.e. Aikido throws). It is also used to illustrate self-defense techniques and situations. This involves two students where one is the attacker and the other is the defender. For additional techniques, please visit the main Aikido techniques section. If you are looking for Jo kata, you should visit the Aikido Jo Katas section. For other katas (i.e. Karate kata or Judo kata), please visit the main Katas & Forms section.

Aikido – Koryu No Kata

Randori No Kata (Tomiki Aikido) – Randori No Kata consists of 17 basic Aikido techniques.
